content.question: Which of the following best characterizes the general argument made in Brutus 1?

choices.label: A large republic would be preferable to a small one because more people could participate.
A small republic would pose more danger to individual liberty than a large republic.
A large republic is dangerous to personal liberty and undermines the states.
A small republic is more susceptible to corruption than a large republic.

content.answer: A large republic is dangerous to personal liberty and undermines the states.
